intro: Guillonea scabra subsp. canescens, commonly known as the rough-stemmed guillonea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune ecosystems. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptations to harsh environments.
